Class SampleArena

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.keele.csc20004.RobotArena
uk.ac.keele.csc20004.sample.SampleArena
public class SampleArena extends RobotArena
An example of implementation of a RobotArena. Please note that this is provided as an example and it DOES NOT necessarily meet the requirements of the coursework. You should implement your own version of the RobotArena. Feel free to extend the abstract class RobotArena and implement the methods as you see fit.
Author:
marcoortolani

  • Constructor Details

    • SampleArena

      public SampleArena(int studentId, int capacity, RepairLine repairLine, Bench bench)
      The constructor for the SampleArena.
      Parameters:
      studentId - your student ID
      capacity - the capacity of the arena
      repairLine - the repair line (needs to be created separately)
      bench - the bench (needs to be created separately)

  • Method Details

    • repair

      public void repair(Robot r)
      This method simulates the repair of a robot after it is extracted from the repair line. Only the components with 0 energy are repaired by using the appropriate bay. You can implement your own version of this method in your implementation of the RobotArena.
      Specified by:
      repair in class RobotArena
      Parameters:
      r - the robot to repair

    • getWinner

      public Robot getWinner()
      Returns the winner of the arena. In this implementation, this method iterates over all the robots in the arena and returns the one with the highest energy level.
      Specified by:
      getWinner in class RobotArena
      Returns:
      the robot with the highest energy level from the arena

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to run the simulation in the sample scenario.
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments
